khrysdiebee:

khrysdiebee:

I think the obvious solution to all of my problems is to build myself a blanket fort and never ever leave it. Let me know if you want to visit. Bring snacks.

Oh yeah, also bring books. I canât seem to be able to read lately (usually reading is my #1 form of escape). I need something thatâs easy to dive in to, I need some mindless, yet entertaining trash fiction. Please, tell me your guilty pleasures. Who knows, maybe we can secretly talk about it later.

When I’m stressed, I like re-reading my favorites. I think a good Terry Pratchett novel is a guilty pleasure for me: I don’t love ‘em in the way I love a Douglas Adams or a Jasper Fforde, but a really good one – Reaper Man, Carpe Jugulum, The Fifth Elephant, Thud – keeps you gripped from start to finish. I haven’t read a Wodehouse novel in a while, but I think they can be equally distracting too. Oh, and The Shadow of the Wind is a pretty gripping young adult novel that does that thing of being a novel that only really works as a novel, if you want to remind yourself what novels can do that audio or video can’t.
